metadata.title: CVE-2017-5121 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate use of JIT optimisation in V8 in Google Chrome prior to61.0.3163.100 for Linux, Windows, and Mac allowed a remote attacker toexecute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page, related tothe escape analysis phase.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5121` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-browser-l10n - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-chromedriver - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0.3163.100-0ubuntu1.1378').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
